---
title: "Prof. Vitor R. Coluci"
---

Prof. Coluci is an associate professor at the School of Technology at University of Campinas. He was a postdoctoral Fellow at the Gleb Wataghin Physics Institute at University 
of Campinas where received his Ph.D. degree in 2004. He was a visiting student at the Nanotech Institute at the University of Texas at Dallas in 2002 and 2003. He also received his S.M. degree in physics from University of Campinas in 2000, and his B.S. degree also in physics from  University of Campinas in 1998. The objective of his research is to develop and use computational simulation tools to study properties of nanomaterials. He has also interests in Scientific Writing and in the use of recent tools (e.g Arduino) to improve the understanding of physical concepts.
